name: Checklist III (For Safety Management System)
description: A checklist to verify compliance with the International Safety Management (ISM) Code.

items.text: Is a copy of the Document of Compliance (DOC) on board and is it effective for the ship type and flag state?
items.details: Check that the annual verification is within 3 months before or after the anniversary date.

items.text: Are ship's personnel familiar with the Company's safety and environmental protection policy?
Is the ship manned with qualified, certified, and medically fit seafarers in accordance with STCW and Flag State requirements?
Has on-board training in support of the SMS been conducted according to procedures?
For multi-national crews, is a working language established and are all orders/instructions clearly understood?
items.details: Ensure all crew can communicate effectively. Check that SMS posters and documents are in a language understood by the personnel.

items.text: Are watch-keeping and rest hours being kept and recorded as required?
Are all officers conversant with the documented procedures for their assigned duties?
Is the crew familiar with the garbage collection and disposal procedure?
Are personnel familiar with procedures for hazardous work, such as enclosed space entry?
Are all officers familiar with the operation of key equipment: Navigation, GMDSS, AIS, BNWAS, ECDIS?
Are charts and Nautical Publications corrected up to the latest Notice to Mariners?
Is the voyage plan prepared with appropriate large-scale charts?
Do engineers have sufficient skills for the smooth function test of the 15ppm Bilge alarm?
Are engineers familiar with FO/DO change-over procedures for SOx Emission Control Areas and bunkering procedures?
Are all crewmembers familiar with their designated muster stations?
Does the crew know the position of isolation valves on the fire main line?
Are the crew familiar with abandon ship drills and can they start the engine of the lifeboat/rescue boat?
Are the crew familiar with fire drills, including the use of a fireman's outfit?
Are the Emergency Contact Numbers updated and available?
Have any non-conformities been reported to the Company?
Has the Company taken corrective action for all reported non-conformities?
Have deficiencies pointed out by the last PSC been reported, investigated, and analyzed to prevent recurrence?
Is the vessel and its equipment being properly maintained to avoid common ISM deficiencies?
items.details: Check for: Hull/hatch corrosion; Engine room oil leaks & equipment malfunctions; Navigation & LSA equipment defects; Firefighting system faults; Ventilator corrosion.

items.text: Are all valid documents (Certificates, SOLAS, MARPOL, STCW manuals, etc.) available onboard?
Have obsolete documents been removed from all areas of work?
items.details: If the Safety Management Manual is bilingual, are both versions up to date?

items.text: Has the internal audit of the vessel by company personnel been carried out at intervals not exceeding 12 months?
Are records of external audits available on board, and have any required corrective actions been taken in a timely manner?
